results.title: Isolated but not Alone
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.I love living in the bush, I especially love rearing my kids in a rural area. It’s something about the sense of freedom, space and community. But distance can be hard when you have a serious illness.
results.description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.I love living in the bush, I especially love rearing my kids in a rural area. group_siblings.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey

results.title: Living not dying
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “For the past six years, I have been living with, not dying from, advanced breast cancer. My original diagnosis was in 1996, when I was 40 years old.”
results.description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “For the past six years, I have been living with, not dying from, advanced breast cancer. results.title: Wild at Heart
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “They say tragedy comes in threes, my mum’s cancer, my brother’s accident and now me.”

results.title: Not worth worrying about
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” I found a mass at the top of my breast. My doctor assured me it was nothing to worry about, I trusted his opinion.”

results.title: Life: What a Ride
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”
results.description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”

results.title: Fighting forest fires with hand tools
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Cherry, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An instructional film to demonstrate the use of hand tools in fighting a forest fire. The use of walkie-talkie communication is demonstrated. Methods of “back-firing” are described and, after the fire, “mopping-up” to prevent a renewed outbreak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lawrence Cherry, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: An instructional film to demonstrate the use of hand tools in fighting a forest fire. The use of walkie-talkie communication is demonstrated. Methods of “back-firing” are described and, after the fire, “mopping-up” to prevent a renewed outbreak.
